The issue with the given code snippet is that it lacks a proper label for the select element, which is important for accessibility. Screen reader users rely on labels to understand the purpose of form elements. To fix this, we can add a label element with a "for" attribute that matches the "id" attribute of the select element.

Here's the corrected version of the code snippet:

```
<label for="selectElement">Select an option:</label>
<select name="..." id="selectElement">
  <!-- options go here -->
</select>
```

In this example, we've added a label element with the text "Select an option:" and linked it to the select element using the "for" attribute. The select element now has an "id" attribute with the value "selectElement" which matches the "for" attribute of the label.
